Angelina Jolie has done it many times over. Celebrities and other public figures are constantly getting into the news on their trips all over the world, particularly when the destination is facing some sort of calamity â€“ natural or otherwise. And if you happen to have any of the talents that agencies like 
 are looking for, you can too!
Sure, there's always the standard vacation of a road trip, a stay at a resort or a cruise, but wouldn't it be oh so much cooler to say, "I spent my vacation helping to provide fresh water to folks in Haiti"? It's work, but for anyone who's looking to end up with the bragging rights, it's well worth it. 
But what if you don't have the skills (or the desire to do all that work)? Well, the folks over at 
 have tons of information about safely traveling all over the world. Maybe that list of places you want to see before you die includes a hidden temple like the one Jolie went to on her journeys to save the world in 
. It's sitting in Cambodia, waiting. Even if you're not the traveling type, you can live vicariously through the 
 of the nomads.
title: Volunteer Travel: Vacations That Make a Difference
author: ElizaRoss-Harrison
